text:
INRIA or nilearn developers?

```
$> git grep -i Copyright doc/conf.py COPYING 
COPYING:Copyright (c) 2007 - 2013 The nilearn developers.
doc/conf.py:copyright = u'INRIA Parietal 2010-2013'
```

you might also like to symlink COPYING into doc/ to avoid diverging them:

```
$> diff COPYING doc/COPYING
3c3
< Copyright (c) 2007 - 2013 The nilearn developers.

---
> Copyright (c) 2009 - 2013 nilearn developers.
15c15
<   c. Neither the name of the nilearn Developers nor the names of

---
>   c. Neither the name of the nilearn Developers  nor the names of
```

and would be neat if at least briefly copyright/licenses of used/shipped 3rd party modules were mentioned in COPYING:

```
doc/sphinxext/LICENSE.txt:Copyright (C) 2008 Stefan van der Walt <stefan@mentat.za.net>, Pauli Virtanen <pav@iki.fi>
doc/sphinxext/LICENSE.txt:Copyright (c) 2006, Enthought, Inc.
doc/sphinxext/LICENSE.txt:Copyright (c) 2002-2008 John D. Hunter; All Rights Reserved.
doc/themes/nilearn/static/jquery.jcarousel.min.js:* Copyright (c) 2014 Jan Sorgalla; Licensed MIT */
doc/themes/nilearn/static/sphinxdoc.css: * :copyright: Copyright 2007-2011 by the Sphinx team, see AUTHORS.
```
title: Please clarify copyrights

text:
Indeed,  we should put nilearn developers. Some of them are employed by inria but not all.

Sent from my phone. Please forgive brevity and mis spelling

On Feb 6, 2015, 18:53, at 18:53, "Loïc Estève" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Good catch! I am probably not the best person for this kind of issues
> but I am convinced we can do something about it and tidy up the
> copyrights.
>

Good catch! I am probably not the best person for this kind of issues but I am convinced we can do something about it and tidy up the copyrights.
